title: Bill gazetted to scrap MPs’ pension scheme
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued for the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill, paving the way for the abolition of long-standing pension entitlements for Members of Parliament and their spouses.

title: Vijitha comes to Harinis rescue
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath has dismissed complaints and accusations directed at the Prime Minister, stating that all allegations against her are baseless.

title: Johnston Fernando appears at FCID over investigation
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning (05) in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: Mahaweli Authority begins safety inspections of reservoirs after recent cyclone
byline: The Mahaweli Authority has begun a comprehensive quality and safety inspection of both large-scale and small-scale reservoirs under its purview, including those used for hydroelectric power generation, following recent landslides and floods triggered by the cyclone “Ditwah”.

title: FSP to stage protest in Colombo against US role in Venezuela
byline: The Frontline Socialist Party is scheduled to hold a protest in Colombo today opposing what it describes as United States intervention in Venezuela.

title: Danish PM tells Trump to stop ’threats’ against Greenland
byline: Denmark’s prime minister has told Donald Trump to ’’stop the threats’’ about taking over Greenland.

title: IMF acts as biggest impediment in drawing FDIs to Sri Lanka
byline: While Sri Lanka has managed to push its Foreign Direct Investments (FDIs) slightly atop the billion dollar mark in 2025, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) policies have put the country in a bind in having polices, particularly when it comes to taxation in making the country an attractive destination for international investors.

title: Trump warns new Venezuelan leader as Maduro set to appear in court
byline: Donald Trump has warned Venezuela’s new leader Delcy Rodríguez she could ’’pay a very big price, probably bigger than Maduro’’ if she ’’doesn’t do what’s right’’.

title: Delay in publishing test results on Ondansetron injection raises suspicious: Doctors’ Union
byline: Nearly three weeks after two suspicious deaths were reported following complications allegedly linked to the administration of the controversial Ondansetron injection imported from India, concerns have been raised over delays in releasing the results of a second laboratory test on the drug, the Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance Chairman  Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: Schools reopen for first semester of 2026 academic year
byline: All schools reopened today (05) for the first phase of the first semester of the 2026 academic year, the Ministry of Education announced.

title: Gem and jewellery industry calls for urgent implementation of reforms
byline: Industry leaders at the opening of FACETS Sri Lanka 2026 have called for the urgent implementation of key reforms discussed with the government to unlock the full potential of the country’s gem and jewellery sector, warning that regulatory delays are holding back a potential multi-billion dollar export industry.

title: Global business cycle analyst slams IMF ‘stability’ narrative as domestic debt doubles to Rs. 20tn
byline: Global business cycle analyst Dr. Kenneth De Zilwa has launched a scathing critique of Sri Lanka’s economic trajectory under the International Monetary Fund (IMF) programme, arguing that the widely touted “stability” is a facade masking a catastrophic deterioration of the national balance sheet.

title: Business registration for cyclone-affected industries resumes
byline: The Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry has announced that the registration of businesses, including export and manufacturing industries affected by Cyclone Ditwah, has resumed as its second phase.

title: Johnston Fernando arrested
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando was arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning (05) in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: Trawler Owners demand action against Seychelles authorities for burning trawler
byline: All Ceylon Multi-day Trawler Owners’ Association has requested the International Organisations and the Sri Lankan government to hold a formal investigation of destroying a multi-day fishing trawler and the arrest of six fishermen by the Seychelles security authorities.

title: Joint opposition alliance is the key : Namal
byline: A joint opposition alliance is the only viable option to change the destiny of the nation, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa said yesterday.

title: Rishad Bathiudeen appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister and Member of Parliament Rishad Bathiudeen appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (05) after being summoned by the commission.

title: Mahinda says NPP efforts falling short
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) Government is making efforts but has so far failed to deliver results, Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said.

title: Wildlife officials hunt for those who electrocuted a jumbo in Welikanda
byline: In the wake of the burning an elephant to death in Mihintale, the death of another wild elephant as a result of the human-elephant conflict was reported yesterday from Welikanda.

title: Body found at Marine Drive, Kollupitiya
byline: A dead body was found at Marine Drive in Kollupitiya today, police said.

title: Talks begin with Seychelles to repatriate fishermen from the destroyed trawler
byline: The Sri Lankan Ministry of Fisheries has initiated high-level diplomatic discussions to secure the return of local fishermen currently held in the Seychelles.

title: Pakistan cricket team to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: The Pakistan Men’s National Cricket Team is scheduled to arrive at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, this evening ahead of a T20 series.

title: Ex-Australia batter Martyn wakes up from coma in ’miracle’ recovery
byline: The 54-year-old, who played 67 Test matches between 1992 and 2006, fell ill late last month and was admitted to a Queensland hospital on 27 December.

title: Cabinet approval next week for private sector involvement in developing Mattala airport
byline: A Cabinet Memorandum will be presented next week seeking approval to call for Expression of Interest (EOI) from local or foreign investors to develop the Mattala international airport under the public private partnership (PPP) model, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Kodituwakku said.

title: SriLankan Airlines debt to be restructured this month: Deputy Minister
byline: The Government is expecting to complete the restructuring of the defaulted debt of SriLankan Airlines this month, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Kodituwakku said.

title: A hypocrisy called the United Nations!
byline: There is a quiet anger spreading across much of the world. It is not the loud kind that fills streets with protests, but a deeper, more painful frustration felt by ordinary people who are watching global justice collapse under the weight of hypocrisy. At the centre of this failure stands the United Nations, an institution created to protect humanity, now increasingly exposed as one that protects power instead.

title: Vijitha comes to Harini's rescue
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath has dismissed complaints and accusations directed at the Prime Minister, stating that all allegations against her are baseless.

title: First-ever food and beverages department for patients launched
byline: The Apeksha Hospital in Maharagama will open a Food and Beverages Department tomorrow (6), marking the first time such a facility is being introduced in a government hospital. The initiative, led by the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, aims to provide customised, nutritious meals to in-house patients under a pilot program.

title: Coconut oil price rises by Rs. 100: National Consumers’ Front
byline: The price of a bottle of coconut oil has risen by about Rs. 100 in the past two weeks, National Consumers’ Front (NCF) Chairman Asela Sampath said.

title: Police search suspect in Mawathagama acid attack
byline: Police are seeking the public’s assistance in locating a suspect wanted in connection with an acid attack on a woman in Mawathagama on December 10, 2025.

title: Man mistakenly arrested over Kohuwala shooting granted police bail
byline: Police have granted bail to a man who was arrested after being mistakenly identified as a suspect wanted in connection with a recent shooting incident in Kohuwala, police said.

title: Magistrate seeks explanation from police over withdrawal of journalist’s case
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today directed the Cinnamon Gardens Police to inform court in writing whether they intend to withdraw the case filed against journalist Gayan Kalpa Gunaratne on charges of criminal force against a police officer and acting in a manner causing a breach of public peace.

title: Bluefin tuna fetches record $3.2m at Tokyo auction
byline: A bulky bluefin tuna made a splash at Tokyo’s Toyosu fish market on Monday morning, fetching a record 510.3 million yen ($3.2m; £2.4m) at the market’s first auction of the year.

title: Johnston Fernando, his youngest son arrested
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and his youngest son, Gerome Kenneth Fernando were arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning (05) in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: Nicolás Maduro and wife en route to New York court
byline: Dramatic images show Venezuela’s seized president Nicolás Maduro being transferred from an armoured vehicle to a helicopter in New York.

title: Navin Dissanayake appointed UNP Vice Chairman
byline: Senior politician Navin Dissanayake has been appointed Vice Chairman of the United National Party (UNP) for 2026.

title: Fake Colombo Stock Exchange Scheme Defrauds Depositors of Over Rs. 17 Million
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) after a fraudulent company defrauded depositors of more than Rs. 17 million by misusing the CSE’s name and logo.

title: Gold price rises after US captures Venezuela’s Maduro
byline: Precious metal prices and shares in defence stocks have risen after the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro increased investors’ concerns about geopolitical risks.

title: ASP and sergeant arrested in bribery probe
byline: An Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) from the Nuwara Eliya Assistant Superintendent of Police Office and a woman police sergeant from the Kalmunai Assistant Superintendent of Police Office were arrested today (05) in connection with a bribery investigation conducted by the Commission on Bribery and Corruption.

title: Johnston Fernando, his youngest son remanded
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and his youngest son, who were arrested this morning, were remanded till January 9 by the Wattala Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Coaching and tuition classes for 2025 A/L exams banned from midnight tomorrow
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that conducting coaching or tuition classes targeting the 2025 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) Examinations will be prohibited from midnight tomorrow (6).

title: Utilise budget allocations with maximum efficiency: President instructs Ministry Secretaries
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that within the prevailing financial constraints, budgetary allocations for 2026 have been made by identifying national priorities and emphasised that it is the responsibility of all Ministry Secretaries and public officials to utilise these funds with maximum efficiency for the benefit of the people.

title: German investors arrive to explore new technical college in Sri Lanka
byline: A group of German investors arrived in Sri Lanka to via the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) , Katunayake, to explore the establishment of a state-of-the-art technical college similar to the existing German Technical College currently operating in the country.

title: Low-level disturbance near Sri Lanka likely to intensify: Meteorology Dept
byline: The Department of Meteorology has warned that a low-level atmospheric disturbance in the Bay of Bengal, located to the southeast of Sri Lanka, is likely to intensify in the coming days.

title: Sri Lanka deeply concerned about recent developments in Venezuela: Foreign Ministry
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka is deeply concerned about the recent developments in Venezuela and is closely monitoring the situation, Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Ceypetco announces fuel price hike from midnight
byline: Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today.
